result.execSummary:
The defendant Quinton A Grimes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: If revoked, Huber privileges for work.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by 3/25/16, cash bail to apply. Failure to pay will result in the entry of a civil judgment. Remainder of the cash bail to be returned to the remitter.

*Restitution is set at $0.*
Obtain and maintain employment, school, or combination of both.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT to possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Quinton A Grimes

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: -Defendant's Notice Of Intent To Pursue Postconviction Relief from Attorney Colin McGinn on behalf of his client; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant sentenced to serve 45 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 1 day time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 6 months.  If revoked, Huber privileges for work.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT to possess or
          use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by 3/25/16, cash bail to apply. 
          Failure to pay will result in the entry of a civil judgment.
          Remainder of the cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
     *   Obtain and maintain employment, school, or
          combination of both.
     *   No firearms; dangerous weapons.
     *   Restitution is set at $0.
 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights received and filed.

Defendant Quinton A Grimes in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.  Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Quinton A Grimes in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing hearing. Court is in jury trial for today's proceedings.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Quinton A Grimes in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Quinton A Grimes in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea. Defense counsel requests adjournment to check status of out of county case.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Quinton A Grimes in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. Scheduling conference held off the record. Potential DPA.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and DPA in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Per Judge McAdams this case should beassigned to a Misd. court.

Defendant Quinton A Grimes in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.
Case is adjourned to Judge McAdams, Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

15RM007091  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02-10-2015

15RM007085  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02-10-2015
Court ordered Defendant not to be in possession of any illegal drugs without a valid prescription; and not to be in possession of any dangerous weapons.

Defendant Quinton A Grimes in court.  Kurt Brian Benkley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 47  for a Pretrial Conference.  Status conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/12/15 @ 1:30pm
